title: Cultural Heritage Data Augmentation: Machine Learning-Based Metadata Calibration and Restoration Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of machine learning and foundational concepts in cultural heritage management
context.additional_context: A course focused on helping current professionals acquire immediately applicable technical skills. Conducted in a BYOD environment with mobile device-supported flexible learning

learning_goals: A hierarchical multimodal classification model applied to cultural heritage image data achieves metadata auto-annotation accuracy of 85% or higher
Capable of applying supervised/unsupervised learning-based image inpainting techniques for damaged cultural heritage restoration
Crawling-preprocessing-augmentation pipeline for international cultural heritage datasets can be constructed and optimized
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
